Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Deep Brain Stimulation in Parkinson's Disease

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, 16 patients with advanced idiopathic Parkinson's disease were recruited

Participants.evidence: 16 patients with advanced idiopathic Parkinson's disease were recruited from multiple surgical centers. Eligibility required evidence of pathological synchrony in the subthalamic region.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved DBS with varying voltages, while no comparator was used.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to explore this mechanism.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the suppression of local field potential (LFP) activity in the 11â€“30 Hz range, measured over a few days post-implantation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not implemented for clinical assessments.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 16 patients with advanced idiopathic Parkinson's disease were recruited

Result_Outcome.evidence: DBS progressively suppressed LFP peaks between 11 and 30 Hz as voltage increased beyond 1.5 V, with median peak power reduced to 54% of baseline at 3.0 V.
